1. Mayor & City Council

Mayor & City Council
====================

![City Council ](http://www.jacksonvilletx.org/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=5921)

Pictured left to right are: Rob Gowin, District 4; Letitia Horace, District 1; Randy Gorham, Mayor; Mindy Gellock, District 2; Tim McRae, District 3 and Mayor Pro-Tem.

The City holds an election for council members two out of every three years. In year one, the Mayor, Council District 1, and Council District 3 are up for election, in year two, Council District 2 and Council District 4 are up for election, in year three, there is no election, then the cycle begins again.

* 2026 Election: Mayor, District 1, and District 3
* 2027 Elections: District 2 and District 4

City Council members may serve for a maximum of three, 3-year terms.

The City Council is the legislative body of the City with a role to adopt laws, policies, and a budget. The City Council appoints a city manager to implement policies, provide city services, maintain the budget, and enforce the laws. The city manager maintains a staff to accomplish those directives. The City Council appoints municipal court judges to adjudicate citations filed by the Jacksonville Police Department and Jacksonville ISD violations and attendance infractions. Finally, they appoint a city attorney to represent the City in all legal matters and a city clerk to maintain the city's records and publish meeting agendas and minutes.

The Jacksonville City Council has two special titles, Mayor and Mayor Pro-Tem. The Mayor serves as the official spokesperson for the City Council and serves as the chairperson, conducting all meetings of the City Council. When the Mayor is not present or available, the Mayor Pro-Tem serves as the chairperson and spokesperson. The position of Mayor Pro-Tem is held by one of the four district councilmembers and is elected by a majority vote of the City Council at the meeting following the election or reelection of the Mayor.

![Randy Gorham](http://www.jacksonvilletx.org/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=4940)

**Randy Gorham - Mayor**

Current Term: 2023-2026

1. Randy graduated from the University of Texas at Tyler in 1981 with a Bachelor of Business Administration concentrating in Accounting. He began his career with a local firm focusing primarily on small businesses where he began to develop a strong knowledge of financial planning, investment analysis and tax issues. In 1986, he earned his CPA license and after five years in public accounting, Randy founded Randy R. Gorham, CPA PC.

Randy is a member of the Texas Society of Certified Public Accountants. His current community involvement includes member of the Jacksonville Rotary Club and Board Member, Founding Board Member of the Jacksonville Literacy Council, Board Member of the Jacksonville United Fund, Advisory Board Member of Living Alternatives of Jacksonville, Board Member of Trinity Mother Frances Hospital Jacksonville, and City Councilman, District 3 for the City of Jacksonville. Past community involvement includes former board member of the East Texas Chapter of Certified Public Accountants, and past board member of the Cherokee County Country Club, where he served as Treasurer and President.

Randy was named 2008 Businessman of the Year by the Jacksonville Chamber of Commerce, and was voted 2010 Outstanding Citizen of the Year by the Jacksonville Chamber of Commerce.

Randy has been married to Cheryl for 42 years. Randy and Cheryl attend Peoples Church in Jacksonville where he serves on their Worship Team. They have three children and seven grandchildren. In his time off, Randy enjoys fishing, spending time with his family, and watching Aggie football.

**Tim McRae - Mayor Pr
![Tim McRae](http://www.jacksonvilletx.org/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=4942)
o-Tem, District 3**

Current Term: 2023-2026

Tim McRae was elected to Council in 2019, after previously serving from 1994-1997 including one year as Mayor Pro-Tem. Tim is a managing partner of Bill McRae Ford Lincoln in Jacksonville, a 1978 graduate of Jacksonville High School, a 1980 graduate of Tyler Junior College and a 1983 graduate of Stephen F. Austin State University with a Bachelors’ in Business Administration. Tim is also a certified instrument rated pilot, receiving his certification in June of 1981 with an instrument rating added in 1984.

Tim is a member of First United Methodist Church of Jacksonville, where he also serves as Chair of the Church Leadership Council. Tim currently serves as Chair of the Nan Travis Foundation Board and the Chair of the Cherokee County Airport Advisory Board. He has served several terms on the Jacksonville Chamber of Commerce Board of Directors and currently serves on the board of the Jacksonville Economic Development Corp. Tim also represents Cherokee County on the NET RMA (North East Texas Regional Mobility Authority) Board.

Tim is a member of Rotary International in Jacksonville and served as a previous president. Tim has served on other boards such as the Family and Child Welfare, Crisis Center, Crime Stoppers (several years as president) and Kiwanis International of Jacksonville. Tim has been a tee-ball coach, a Sunday school teacher and served on various committees surrounding the school, church and community.

Tim was bestowed the honors of Jacksonville Chamber of Commerce 2004 Outstanding Business Man and the 2009 Outstanding Citizen of the year. Tim and his wife Dawn have been married for over 33 years and have two children, Lindsey and Mitch, ages 32 and 30. They also have one daughter-in-law (Maria) and four grandsons (Sutton, Felix, Zeke and Jax).

![Letitia Horace District 2 Indoor Cropped](http://www.jacksonvilletx.org/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=4086)

**Letitia Horace - Councilmember, District 1**

Current Term: 2023-2026

Her professional career began with a nonprofit organization in the DFW area.  It was there that she was introduced to the concept of community revitalization & development.  Letitia worked in collaboration with local leaders to empower them and connect them to local resources that would assist them in bringing about effective change in their respective communities.  It was this experience that solidified her desire to continue a career path dedicated to others.  In 2004, she moved to Denver, CO and for the next 15 years, worked with non-profit organizations creating and developing vital services for underserved communities with a focus on providing safe, decent affordable housing.  Within these organizations, she managed multi-million dollar operational and departmental budgets as well as a real estate portfolio that included over 300 residential units and 5 commercial properties.  During her time in Colorado, Letitia was a member of the Colorado State Housing Board as a Governor appointee, a Board Member for Colorado Housing Assistance Corporation and for several other nonprofit organizations.

Letitia is married to the love of her life, Delano Horace, who is a native of San Antonio.  They have been married for 17 years (and counting) and have two wonderful and amazing sons, Daylen & Devon.  Since moving to Jacksonville in 2018, she has fully immersed herself in the Jacksonville community.  She and her husband completed the Citizens Police Academy Class and Letitia was also a member of Jacksonville’s Charter Committee and is currently enrolled in the Jacksonville Leadership Institute Class 2022-2023.  Letitia has volunteered with several organizations including IMPACT Jacksonville, HOPE, and the Cherokee County Human Needs Network. She has also played an integral role in several projects, including initiating Jacksonville’s first Housing Needs Assessment, organizing Voter Registration Drives, developing & facilitating Homebuying Workshops, participating in the Lincoln Park Revitalization efforts, and organizing Neighbors Helping Neighbors which is a community workday event in which volunteers helped paint, landscape and complete minor repairs projects on homes in the Lincoln Park community.  She is passionate about building a better community for all, and she is eager to help District 1, whose heritage and revitalization are near & dear to her heart, to become a thriving part of our beloved town once again.

![Mindy Gellock](http://www.jacksonvilletx.org/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=4939)

**Mindy Gellock - Councilmember, District 2**

Current Term: 2024-2027

Mindy Folden Gellock was born and raised in Jacksonville and is the daughter of Wilson and Joyce Folden.  She is married to Ed Gellock.  After graduating from Jacksonville High School, Mindy attended and graduated from Stephen F. Austin State University with a B.S. degree in Biology.  Mindy spent the majority of her career in the pharmaceutical industry as a Clinical Research Associate and in CRO management.  Mindy retired in May 2024. Mindy is a member of Central Baptist Church where she and Ed are active in the Micah Sunday school class.

After residing in New Jersey and Pennsylvania, Mindy returned to Texas in 1997, where she and Ed resided in Frisco, Prosper and Mabank (Cedar Creek Lake) before moving home to Jacksonville in 2014.

Mindy is in her 1
three year term as District 2 Councilwoman.

![Rob Gowin](http://www.jacksonvilletx.org/ImageRepository/Document?documentId=4941)

**Rob Gowin - Councilmember, District 4**

Current Term: 2024-2027

Councilman Rob Gowin was born in Jacksonville. He graduated from Baylor University 1990 with a Bachelor of Arts music degree. Councilman Gowin owns and operates a local restaurant. He has served on city council since 2017 and served as Mayor Pro-Tem in May 2019 until May 2023.
